mods.abstract: Bows-on to the tide, each of these three "skiffs" are loaded by oyster fishermen with one hundred and fifty sacks of oysters tonged from the shallows of Barataria Bay. The oysters are culled in the skiffs. Small ones are dumped on the spot and the larger ones are rebedded in salt water areas where they are conditioned for market.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection
